comments: test_stream_only1 covering the steam query smoke cases for streaming only mode.

tests.name: stream bumble aggregation join table
tests.description: stream stream aggregation join

statements.query: select a.id, b.type, max(a.value), window_start, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 5 second) as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id group by a.id, b.type, window_start, window_end

tests.name: stream bumble aggregation join table w/where
tests.description: stream stream aggregation join table w/where

statements.query: select a.id, b.type, max(a.value), window_start, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 5 second) as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id where b.type = 'roof' or b.type = 'field' or b.type = 'wall' group by a.id, b.type, window_start, window_end

tests.name: tumble aggregation based on vanilla subquery extracts timestamp from json
tests.description: tranform function in subquery and run tumble on the subquery

statements.query: with transformed as (select id, value, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as tranformed_timestamp from test6_stream_only1) select id, max(value), window_start, window_end from tumble(transformed, tranformed_timestamp, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: hopping aggregation based on vanilla subquery extracts timestamp from json
tests.description: tranform function in subquery to extract timestamp from a json and run hopping on the subquery

statements.query: with transformed as (select id, value, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as tranformed_timestamp from test6_stream_only1) select id, max(value), window_start, window_end from hop(transformed, tranformed_timestamp, interval 2 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: global aggregation based on vanilla subquery extracts timestamp from json
tests.description: tranform function in subquery to extract timestamp from a json and run global aggregation on the subquery

statements.query: with transformed as (select id, value, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as tranformed_timestamp from test6_stream_only1) select id, max(value) from transformed group by id limit 6 emit periodic 5s

tests.name: tail based on tumble subquery extracts timestamp from json
tests.description: tail based on tumble subquery extracts timestamp from json

statements.query: with transformed_a as (select id, avg(value) as value_avg, window_end as avg_time from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 2 second) group by id, window_end) select id, value_avg, avg_time from transformed_a

tests.name: tumble based on tumble subquery
tests.description: tranform function in subquery to extract timestamp from a json and run tumble aggregation on the subquery

statements.query: with transformed_a as (select id, avg(value) as value_avg, window_end as avg_time from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 2 second) group by id, window_end) select id, max(value_avg), window_end from tumble(transformed_a, avg_time, interval 5 second) group by id, window_end

tests.name: tumble minK based on tumble subquery
tests.description: tumble minK based on tumble subquery

statements.query: with transformed_a as (select id, avg(value) as value_avg, window_end as avg_time from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 2 second) group by id, window_end) select id, min_k(value_avg, 1), window_end from tumble(transformed_a, avg_time, interval 5 second) group by id, window_end

tests.name: hopping avg based on tumble sum subquery
tests.description: hopping avg based on tumble sum subquery

statements.query: with transformed_a as (select id, sum(value) as value_q, window_end as q_time from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 1 second) group by id, window_end) select id, avg(value_q), window_end from hop(transformed_a, q_time, interval 2 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_end

tests.name: tumble avg based on hopping sum subquery
tests.description: tumble avg based on hopping sum subquery

statements.query: with transformed_a as (select id, sum(value) as value_s, window_end as s_time from hop(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 1 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_end) select id, avg(value_s), window_end from tumble(transformed_a, s_time, interval 3 second) group by id, window_end

tests.name: tumble avg based on hist subquery
tests.description: tumble avg based on hist subquery

statements.query: with transformed as (select id, value, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as tranformed_timestamp from table(test6_stream_only1)) select id, max(value), window_end from tumble(transformed, tranformed_timestamp, interval 5 second) group by id, window_end

tests.name: hop count based on table subquery
tests.description: hop count based on table subquery

statements.query: with transformed as (select id, value, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as tranformed_timestamp from table(test6_stream_only1)) select id, count(*), window_start, window_end from hop(transformed, tranformed_timestamp, interval 4 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: tumble count based on tumble join table subquery
tests.description: tumble count based on tumble join table subquery

statements.query: with joined_stream as (select a.id, b.type, max(a.value), window_start as joined_w_start, window_end as joined_w_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 3 second) as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id where b.type = 'roof' or b.type = 'field' or b.type = 'wall' group by a.id, b.type, window_start, window_end) select id, count(*), window_start, window_end from tumble(joined_stream, joined_w_end, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: hop count based on tumble join table subquery
tests.description: hop count based on tumble join table subquery

statements.query: with joined_stream as (select a.id, b.type, max(a.value), window_start as joined_w_start, window_end as joined_w_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 3 second) as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id where b.type = 'roof' or b.type = 'field' or b.type = 'wall' group by a.id, b.type, window_start, window_end) select id, count(*), window_start, window_end from hop(joined_stream, joined_w_end, interval 3 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: tumble count based on hop join table subquery
tests.description: tumble count based on hop join table subquery

statements.query: with joined_stream as (select a.id, b.type, max(a.value), window_start as joined_w_start, window_end as joined_w_end from hop(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 3 second, interval 5 second) as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id where b.type = 'roof' or b.type = 'field' or b.type = 'wall' group by a.id, b.type, window_start, window_end) select id, count(*), window_start, window_end from tumble(joined_stream, joined_w_end, interval 3 second) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: hop count based on hop join table subquery
tests.description: hop count based on hopping sum subquery

statements.query: with joined_stream as (select a.id, b.type, max(a.value), window_start as joined_w_start, window_end as joined_w_end from hop(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, interval 3 second, interval 5 second) as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id where b.type = 'roof' or b.type = 'field' or b.type = 'wall' group by a.id, b.type, window_start, window_end) select id, count(*), window_start, window_end from hop(joined_stream, joined_w_end, interval 3 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: global count based on tail join table subquery
tests.description: global count based on tail join table subquery

statements.query: with joined_stream as (select a.id, b.type, a.value, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as tranformed_timestamp from test6_stream_only1 as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id where b.type = 'roof' or b.type = 'field' or b.type = 'wall') select id, count(*) from joined_stream group by id
kill query where query_id='602-1'

tests.name: tumble count based on tail join table subquery
tests.description: tumble count based on tail join table subquery

statements.query: with joined_stream as (select a.id, b.type, a.value, a.timestamp, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as transformed_timestamp from test6_stream_only1 as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id where b.type = 'roof' or b.type = 'field' or b.type = 'wall') select id, count(*), window_start, window_end from tumble(joined_stream,transformed_timestamp, 5s) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: hop count based on tail join table subquery
tests.description: hop count based on tail join table subquery

statements.query: with joined_stream as (select a.id, b.type, a.value, a.timestamp, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as transformed_timestamp from test6_stream_only1 as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id = b.id where b.type = 'roof' or b.type = 'field' or b.type = 'wall') select id, count(*), window_start, window_end from hop(joined_stream,timestamp, 2s, 5s) group by id, window_start, window_end

tests.name: tumble sum based on tail join table view
tests.description: tumble sum based on tail join table view

statements.query: drop view if exists test6_stream_only1_join_v

create view if not exists test6_stream_only1_join_v as select a.id, b.type, a.value, a.json, a.timestamp, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as transformed_timestamp, _tp_time from test6_stream_only1 as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id =b.id
select id, type, sum(value), window_start, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1_join_v, timestamp, 5s) group by id, type, window_start, window_end

tests.name: global sum based on tail join table view
tests.description: global sum based on tail join table view

statements.query: drop view if exists test6_stream_only1_join_v

create view if not exists test6_stream_only1_join_v as select a.id, b.type, a.value, a.json, a.timestamp, to_datetime(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')) as transformed_timestamp, _tp_time from test6_stream_only1 as a join table(test6_stream_only1_d) as b on a.id =b.id
select type, count(value) from test6_stream_only1_join_v group by type limit 5 emit periodic 5s

tests.name: query_mode='table'
tests.description: query_mode='table'

statements.query: select id, avg(value) from test6_stream_only1 group by id settings query_mode='table'

tests.name: asterisk_include_reserved_columns = false
tests.description: asterisk_include_reserved_columns = false

statements.query: select *  from test6_stream_only1 where id = 'dev1' settings query_mode='table', asterisk_include_reserved_columns=false

tests.name: seek to earliest
tests.description: seek to earliest, no command could clear stream storage so not stable, so use test6_stream_only1_seek table created during setup to avoid stream storage impact, will introduce topic clean function in test6_stream_only1 automation later

statements.query: select id, count(*), window_start, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, timestamp, 5s) where id = 'dev1' group by id, window_start, window_end settings seek_to = 'earliest'

tests.name: seek to ago interval
tests.description: seek to ago interval

statements.query: select id, value from test6_stream_only1 settings seek_to='-5s'

tests.name: seek to specific time
tests.description: seek to specific time

statements.query: select id, count(*), window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, 5s) group by id, window_end settings seek_to='2021-11-02T20:00:05'

tests.name: streaming tail from materialized view as global aggregation by sum and group by id w/by 5s periodic
tests.description: create materialized view as global aggregation by sum and group by id w/by 5s periodic, select id, sum_value from mv

statements.query: drop view if exists test6_stream_only1_stream_sum_view
create materialized view test6_stream_only1_stream_sum_view as select id, sum(value) as sum_value from test6_stream_only1 group by id emit periodic 5s
select id, sum_value from test6_stream_only1_stream_sum_view
kill query where query_id = '601-1'

tests.name: neighbor
tests.description: function neighbor for streaming

statements.query: select value, neighbor(value, -3) as prev_3, neighbor(value, -3, 0) as prev_3_0 from test6_stream_only1

tests.name: tumble w/funcs: json, to_date, replace_regex, to_time
tests.description: extract timestamp from json and run tumble on it, and run all func rename.

statements.query: select id, max(value), json_extract_bool(json, 'bool') as json_bool, to_date(json_extract_string(json, '1953')) as to_date, replace_regex(json_extract_string(json, '1953'), '11*', 'a') as replace_regex, json_extract_float(json, 'float') as json_float, json_extract_int(json, 'int') as json_extract_int, json_query(json, '$.array[*][0 to 2, 4]') as json_query, json_extract_array_raw(json, 'array') as json_extract_array_raw, json_value(json, '$.array[*][0 to 2, 4]') as json_value, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, to_time(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')), interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:10' group by id, json, json_bool, json_float, json_extract_int, to_date, replace_regex, json_extract_array_raw, json_value, window_end

tests.name: tumble w/funcs: json, to_date, replace_regex, to_time
tests.description: extract timestamp from json and run tumble on it, and run all func rename.

statements.query: select id, max(value), json_extract_bool(json, 'bool') as json_bool, to_date(json_extract_string(json, '1953')) as to_date, replace_regex(json_extract_string(json, '1953'), '11*', 'a') as replace_regex, json_extract_float(json, 'float') as json_float, json_extract_int(json, 'int') as json_extract_int, json_query(json, '$.array[*][0 to 2, 4]') as json_query, json_extract_array_raw(json, 'array') as json_extract_array_raw, json_value(json, '$.array[*][0 to 2, 4]') as json_value, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, to_time(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')), interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:10' group by id, json, json_bool, json_float, json_extract_int, to_date, replace_regex, json_extract_array_raw, json_value, window_end

tests.name: tumble w/funcs: to_int, happy path
tests.description: extract timestamp from json and run tumble on it, and run all func rename.

statements.query: select id, max(value), to_int8(json_extract_string(json, 'int8')) as to_int8, to_int16(json_extract_string(json, 'int16')) as to_int16, to_int(json_extract_string(json, 'int32')) as to_int32, to_int64(json_extract_string(json, 'int64')) as to_int64, to_int128(json_extract_string(json, 'int128')) as to_int128, to_int256(json_extract_string(json, 'int256')) as to_int256, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, to_time(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')), interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:10' group by id, json, to_int8, to_int16, to_int32, to_int64, to_int128, to_int256, window_end

tests.name: tumble w/funcs: to_int, boundry
tests.description: extract timestamp from json and run tumble on it, and run all func rename.

statements.query: select id, max(value), to_int8(json_extract_string(json, 'int8')) as to_int8, to_int16(json_extract_string(json, 'int16')) as to_int16, to_int32(json_extract_string(json, 'int32')) as to_int32, to_int64(json_extract_string(json, 'int64')) as to_int64, to_int128(json_extract_string(json, 'int128')) as to_int128, to_int256(json_extract_string(json, 'int256')) as to_int256, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, to_time(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')), interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:10' group by id, json, to_int8, to_int16, to_int32, to_int64, to_int128, to_int256, window_end

tests.name: tumble w/funcs: to_int, out of boundry
tests.description: extract timestamp from json and run tumble on it, and run all func rename.

statements.query: select id, max(value), to_int8(json_extract_string(json, 'int8')) as to_int8, to_int16(json_extract_string(json, 'int16')) as to_int16, to_int32(json_extract_string(json, 'int32')) as to_int32, to_int64(json_extract_string(json, 'int64')) as to_int64, to_int128(json_extract_string(json, 'int128')) as to_int128, to_int256(json_extract_string(json, 'int256')) as to_int256, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, to_time(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')), interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:10' group by id, json, to_int8, to_int16, to_int32, to_int64, to_int128, to_int256, window_end

tests.name: tumble w/funcs: to_decimal, happy path
tests.description: extract timestamp from json and run tumble on it, and run all func rename.

statements.query: select id, max(value), to_decimal(json_extract_string(json, 'decimal32'), 5) as to_decimal32, to_decimal64(json_extract_string(json, 'decimal64'), 10) as to_decimal64, to_decimal128(json_extract_string(json, 'decimal128'), 20) as to_decimal128, to_decimal256(json_extract_string(json, 'decimal256'),30) as to_decimal256, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, to_time(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')), interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:10' group by id, json, to_decimal32, to_decimal64, to_decimal128, to_decimal256, window_end

tests.name: tumble w/funcs: to_decimal, boundry
tests.description: extract timestamp from json and run tumble on it, and run all func rename.

statements.query: select id, max(value), to_decimal32(json_extract_string(json, 'decimal32'), 8) as to_decimal32, to_decimal64(json_extract_string(json, 'decimal64'), 17) as to_decimal64, to_decimal128(json_extract_string(json, 'decimal128'), 37) as to_decimal128, to_decimal256(json_extract_string(json, 'decimal256'),75) as to_decimal256, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, to_time(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')), interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:10' group by id, json, to_decimal32, to_decimal64, to_decimal128, to_decimal256, window_end

tests.name: tumble w/funcs: array, happy path)
tests.description: extract timestamp from json and run tumble on it, and run all func rename.

statements.query: select id, max(value), json_extract_array_raw(json, 'array1') as array1, json_extract_array_raw(json, 'array1') as array2 , array_concat(array1, array2) as array_concat, length(array_concat) as array_length, window_end from tumble(test6_stream_only1, to_time(json_extract_string(json, 'create_time')), interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:10' group by id, json, array1, array2, array_concat, array_length, window_end

tests.name: hop w/transformed timestamp
tests.description: tranform function in subquery and run tumble on the subquery

statements.query: select id, max(value), window_end from hop(test6_stream_only1, to_datetime64(_tp_append_time, 3, 'UTC'), interval 2 second, interval 5 second) where window_end < '2021-11-02 20:00:09' group by id, window_end

tests.name: inputs sample
tests.description: ingest data into test_stream_only1 w/full columes and values

statements.query: truncate stream test6_stream_only1
insert into test6_stream_only1 (id, location, value, json, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 370, 'jsonstring', '1999-01-01 11:11:11')
insert into test6_stream_only1 (id, location, value, json, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 380, 'jsonstring', '1999-01-01 11:11:11')
select id, location, value,json, timestamp from table(test6_stream_only1)
